cards.headline: What's the most important environmental problem in your community?

cards.text: Today we'd like you to assist us with a new series we're producing. We're reaching out to you, our audience, to document the environmental problems you care about.

Follow this brief assignment, and help set our editorial agenda. In addition to sharing the best stories on Radio Zamaneh, we will assign one of our staff reporters to do a follow-up series on the most compelling story.

goals: First, capture an image of the location of the problem you want to highlight.

cards.text: After you've captured a clip of the location, you should continue with your story. We recommend you focus first on documenting the problem. After this, investigate the public's reaction or response to the issue.

goals: Show us how the environment is affected.
Capture something that shows the result of the environmental problem.
Capture the cause of the environmental problem.
Get close, and show us how intense the problem is.

cards.text: Now in this second group of shots, we'd like you to capture the reaction of the public to the problem. Be sure to include people in each of these shots.

goals: Capture someone responding to the problem.
Ask the same person: What is your opinion of the problem?
Show a new person  encountering the result of the environmental problem.
Ask the new person: "What should be done about this problem?"
Capture a shot of the place that shows several people near the problem.

cards.text: If possible, you should interview two more people. Ask them to tell you their opinion of the problem.

goals: What is your opinion of the problem?
What is your opinion of the problem?

cards.text: On the next card you will be able to review and order your clips. If you want to trim a clip, tap the clip image.
Think about whether you want to use a narration over the first set of clips, to introduce the problem.
Another approach is to let the people you interviewed tell the story, and distribute all of the first clips throughout the story.
If you want to narrate your story, write the narration first. Be specific and write to your pictures.
When you are satisfied with your story, prepare a description, and click publish. Make sure you add the tag #MyEnvironment to your description.
